en.emailConfirmation: Email confirmation has been sent to
en.yourResponse: Your response will be sent to the applicant. They can then apply for the court order which will divorce them and the respondent.
en.claimedCostsTitle: If the applicant has claimed their costs
en.claimedCostsText: The court will make a decision on this at the same time as it considers whether the divorce should be granted. You'll be sent an email when the decision has been made, and the date of the hearing at which the cost order will be made.
en.objectingToCostsOrderText1: You can object to a costs order if you don't think that you should pay it. You'll need to email the court at least 14 days before the hearing, giving your reasons.
en.objectingToCostsOrderText2: You can contact the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre if you don't hear anything back after 6 weeks.
en.ifYouNeedHelpText: You can contact the divorce centre if you need help. Court staff can’t give you legal advice however, and you should speak to a solicitor or legal adviser.
en.helpImproveText: Please help us improve this service by leaving your feedback.

guidance.title: Guidance on GOV.UK
guidance.howWifeHusbandResponds: How to respond to a divorce application
guidance.decreeNisiLink: Get a divorce
guidance.childrenAndDivorceLink: Children and divorce
guidance.moneyAndPropertyLink: Money and property

en.whatYouNeedToDoNow: What you need to do now
en.submitAnswerToDivorce: You must now submit the 'answer to a divorce application' form. The deadline for the court to receive this is 21 days from the date you first signed in to respond to the divorce application.
en.fillInPaperForm: Download and fill in the paper form.
en.feeToPay: You'll have to pay a £{{ feesDefendDivorce }} fee when you submit the form. If you have little or no savings, are on certain benefits or have a low income you may be able to get help with paying this fee.
en.hearingAboutDivorce: You may have to go to a hearing about the divorce.
en.dontSubmitAnswer: If you don't submit your answer before the deadline, then the applicant can continue the divorce as if you hadn't said that you intended to defend it.
